content.body: Andreu Botella (he/they): yeah, otherwise it would have used ASCII whitespace (I think it might have done so initially, even)

content.body: timothygu: that's a nice find, also :-(

Feeling conflicted about tests like https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/blob/master/html/semantics/scripting-1/the-script-element/script-charset-02.html passing review. On one hand, it caught a bug (not yet sure what) in my code. On the other hand, it tests something more than it's meant to. (Note the location of the `meta` after a `div`.)

content.body: Earlier, I found a bug in my code due to WPT author metadata having non-ASCII even though the test lacked `<meta charset=utf-8>`, so I guess that was good actually.
